caption: Table 3: Ablation study on adding perturbations to different modalities and on the VILLA algorithm.
Table 4: Probing analysis of the attention heads in pre-trained UNITER and VILLA models.
Table 5: Results on LXMERT with VILLA-fine (finetuning).

Table 6: Results on VQA-Rephrasings. Both UNITER and VILLA use the base model size. Baseline results are 

copied from [57].

Table 1a, we have reported the experimental results on the test-dev and test-std splits of 
VQA. More detailed results on each question type are provided in Table 7. As shown, VILLA improves over 
UNITER on all the question types.
